title: DutchMaster ? Where to find
content:
I have a typeface I need to purchase for a client, I have googled already, can't remember how I came across it but I have it already. I just need to purchase it.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 4.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%204.pdf) | 13.36 KB |
author: slewfoot

comments.content: I don't know, the font I have is called DutchMaster but it could have an alias... do you have an example of Macbeth?

_Another 'alternate' may be_ ' [GoodFellow](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/solotype/goodfellow/)', _by Dan X Solo_..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/www.formlos.net/)
I saw the link, it looks a little bolder. Notice the difference in the "4"

hmm, well, I need something that is going to be read on TV at a smaller size and those two are a little too bold... the example of DutchMaster is taller and wider and a little thinner. MacBeth is very close, but not quite going to work... let me know if you know of anything else... thanks for your quick responses though... I am still looking myself.

It seems 'DutchMaster' _( Alias )_ was available on a CD Rom named 'Great American Font Works' released and distributed by 'Silver Graphics', about 10 years ago..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/www.formlos.net/)
Yes, it was Silver Graphics... do you know how I can purchase this... Thank Formlos, you are the man! Now if we can find that CD Rom.

I am not too sure about the legal issues involved with said 'Collection', and all those links I found for 'Silver Graphics' or 'Great American Font Works' were outdated, of course.. So, Sorry, But, I have no clue where you could possibly still find that CD..

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/www.formlos.net/)

Some more info for you:

Silver Graphics, Roger Hartley,. PO Box 485, Pennington Gap, VA. 24277; (540) 546-3800 voice, (540). 546-2380, fax(800) 888-1550. [www.naxs.com/silver/fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019015022/http:/www.naxs.com/silver/fonts "www.naxs.com/silver/fonts")

Roger Hartley, (276) 546-4000, 122 Oakwood Ave, Pennington Gap, VA 24277

from Luc's site at McGill U  
Silver Graphics  
Company run by Roger Hartley, Pennington Gap, VA. The link went dead--its parent is The Design Center / DT&G.
